results.title: Women of Utopia
results.creator_credit: Elisabeth Knight, Keith Gow and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”.
With jokes and good humour, the Aboriginal women of Utopia cattle station show how they make their beautiful and exotic batik fabrics. Some of the women featured are Emily Ngwarai, Gloria Pitjara, Rosie Kunoth and Myrtle Pitjara. Also shows gathering/hunting of food and the cooking of it. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Women of the Toubou
results.creator_credit: Anne Balfour Fraser and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Presents a documentary on the African tribe known as the Toubou. Explains that the tribe revolves around a strong matriarchy but is extremely protective of their beautiful, but strong, enduring, graceful women.
results.description: Presents a documentary on the African tribe known as the Toubou. Explains that the tribe revolves around a strong matriarchy but is extremely protective of their beautiful, but strong, enduring, graceful women.

results.title: Women of the sun: 25 years later (A)
results.creator_credit: Generation Films, Bob Weis and Julie Andrews
results.brief_description: The impact of the landmark 1981 Australian television drama series “Women of the Sun” on its audience was profound. Groundbreaking in its attempts to present stories of Aboriginal Australian women from their own perspectives and in their own languages, the series won the United Nations Media Peace Prize. In this moving documentary, Bob Weis - the producer of the series - explores the effects “Women of the Sun” has had on the lives of some of those involved with its making. Weis interviews some of the people who acted in the series - Justine Saunders, Shirley Nirrpurrangyydji, Naykalan Mununggur, Michelle LaCombe and Eva Johnson - as well as series co-writer Sonia Borg, and indigenous academic Marcia Langton. The film also features remarkable archival footage of series co-writer, poet and educator Hyllus Maris.

results.title: Women of the sun (A)
results.creator_credit: Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films
results.brief_description: A series of four dramas each of which focuses on the story of one Aboriginal woman at different stages of the history of white Australia, to illustrate some of the injustices which have been inflicted on the Aboriginals in the past.

results.title: Women of the silent era : Virgins, vamps and heroines
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: This delightful selection of moving images from the past shows on screen roles and highlights the off camera activities of women, in the pioneering days of Australias silent cinema. The featured scenes are from the following films: A Maidens distress (1911) ; The Joan of Arc of Loos (1916) ; The Woman suffers (1918) ; The Breaking of the Drought (1920) ; Sunshine Sally (1922) ; Jewelled nights (1925) ; Painted daughters (1925) ; Those who love (1926) ; The Far Paradise (1928) ; The Cheaters (1929).
results.title_for_label: Women of the silent era : Virgins, vamps and heroines

results.title: Women of the Royal Australian Air Force
results.creator_credit: Australia. Royal Australian Air Force. Directorate of Training and Australia. Royal Air Force. Films Advisory Bureau
results.brief_description: Presents the vocational and recreational opportunities for women in the RAAF. Shows training, and work in many fields from cooking, and map-making to nursing. Shows the attractions of off-duty life.

results.title: Women of Aibom: in the time before before
results.creator_credit: Department of Information and Extension Services and Boris Cook
results.brief_description: The making of clay pots is very important for the women of Aibom. Itm is their means of barter for the food which is grown in other villages. The methods of making, decorating and firing the pots are shown.

results.title: Women in the workforce: changes
results.creator_credit: Kent Chadwick, Victorian Film Corporation and Karin Altmann
results.brief_description: Shows the changing roles of women in the workforce, including individual cases of women undertaking careers which were once traditionally exclusively male, or male dominated. The women working in non-traditional jobs include a tram driver, an electrician, a gardener, a bank manager, a plumber, an explosives expert and a lead singer in a band.

results.title: Women in sports an informal history
results.creator_credit: Altana Films, Dan Klugherz and Arthur Zitrin
results.brief_description: Surveys the participation of women in sports from classical times to the present day. Discusses prejudice against the physically active woman, the growing awareness of women’s rights as sports participants, and the new enthusiasm of women for sports. Incorporates archival footage and drawings and features famous sportswomen including, Sonja Henie, Margaret Smith-Court, and Billie Jean King.
